TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi beforefieldinit SqlServerRetryingExecutionStrategy extends Microsoft.EntityFrameworkCore.Storage.ExecutionStrategy

Docs.summary: An implementation for retrying failed executions on SQL Server.

remarks.para: This strategy is specifically tailored to SQL Server (including Azure SQL). It is pre-configured with error numbers for transient errors that can be retried. Additional error numbers to retry on can also be supplied.

The service lifetime is . This means that each instance will use its own instance of this service. The implementation may depend on other services registered with any lifetime. The implementation does not need to be thread-safe.
See Connection resiliency and database retries for more information and examples.

Docs.param: The context on which the operations will be invoked.
Docs.remarks: Default values of 6 for the maximum retry count and 30 seconds for the maximum default delay are used.

Docs.summary: The default minimum time delay between retries for throttling errors.

Protected Overrides Function GetNextDelay (lastException As Exception) As Nullable(Of TimeSpan)
override this.GetNextDelay : Exception -> Nullable<TimeSpan>

Docs.param: The exception thrown during the last execution attempt.
Docs.summary: Determines whether the operation should be retried and the delay before the next attempt.
Docs.returns: Returns the delay indicating how long to wait for before the next execution attempt if the operation should be retried; otherwise

MemberSignature.Value: protected override bool ShouldRetryOn (Exception exception);
.method familyhidebysig virtual instance bool ShouldRetryOn(class System.Exception exception) cil managed
Protected Overrides Function ShouldRetryOn (exception As Exception) As Boolean
override this.ShouldRetryOn : Exception -> bool

Docs.param: The exception object to be verified.
Docs.summary: Determines whether the specified exception represents a transient failure that can be compensated by a retry. Additional exceptions to retry on can be passed to the constructor.
Docs.returns: if the specified exception is considered as transient, otherwise .
